result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Paul Drasen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance AMENDED FROM Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Current sentence if revoked

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Current sentence if revoked

miscConds.notes: DNA sample previously ordered and provided, therefore, not ordered on this case.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.

Defendant must attend 1 self-help meeting per day and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance AMENDED FROM Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)

Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.
